Class SavedGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • SavedGame

  • public class SavedGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Deals with saving a game and restoring a saved game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      Saves the game played so far.

      • SavedGame

        public SavedGame()

    • Method Detail

      • saveGame

        public static void saveGame(java.lang.String playComputerStr,
            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> code,
            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> possibleColours,
            java.util.ArrayList<Row> rows)
        Saves the game played so far.
        Parameters:
        playComputerStr - "true" if game is Computer v. Computer, "false" otherwise.
        code - The code the player is trying to guess.
        possibleColours - List of possible colours to choose from when guessing code.
        rows - Contains the guesses made so far and their indicators.

      • getCurrentGame

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrentGame()
        Writes all the information stored in theGame file to an array list.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing all the information about the last, unfinished, game that was saved.

      • clearFile

        public static void clearFile()
        Clears the file where the game was being saved.

      • getCurrentCode

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrentCode()
        Retrieves the code of the saved game.
        Returns:
        The code from the saved game.

      • getCurrentRows

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrentRows()
        Retrieves all the rows of the saved game.

        Rows are an object of type Row. Each row contains a single guess and its associated indicators.

        Returns:
        All the rows from the saved game.

      • getCurrentPossibleColours

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrentPossibleColours()
        Retrieves the list of possible colours of the saved game.

        The possible colours are all the colours that can be chosen from when the user is making their guess.

        Returns:
        The list of possible colours from the saved game.

      • getPlayComputer

        public static java.lang.String getPlayComputer()
        Retrieves whether a human is breaking the code or whether it is a human.
        Returns:
        String indicating whether a human or computer is breaking the code.
